result.execSummary:
The defendant James A. Carroll Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Kathleen Henry shall, within fourteen calendar days of the
date of this order: (1) file the petition for review with her original signature; (2) file an electronic version of the petition for review bearing her signature; and (3) serve one copy of the petition for review bearing her signature on opposing counsel. Failure to comply with these directives may result in the dismissal of the petition for review.
It is Ordered that the motion is granted. Plaintiff-respondent's response shall be served and filed on or before 11/26/21.

Order on Postconviction Motion

ec: DA, Attorney Johnson, Attorney Henry, Defendant

02:13pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant James A. Carroll in court with attorney Kathleen Green Henry.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearances are by Zoom. 
Victim rights compliance verified. 
Court reviews pending motion to withdraw the plea in this matter. 
Atty. Henry verifes that the bais of the filing is manifest injustice due to ineffectife assistance of counsel. 
Court and Counsel review procedural issues related to the burden in this matter based upon application of case law related to the Bangert or Bentley cases in this hearing. 
Response regarding procedural issues and burden shift presented in Atty. Henry. 
Court establishes that Counsel agree that the proper procedure for this hearing is based upon the procedure established by the Bentley case. 

Defendant sworn and testifies: (by Zoom)
-  Direct examination by Atty. Henry
-  Cross examination by DA Hall

Recess 3:11am; Recalled at 3:21pm
Defendant recalled and testifies: (by Zoom)
-  Additional examination by Atty. Henry

Atty. De La Rosa sworn and testifies: (by Zoom)
-  Direct examination by Atty. Henry
-  Cross examination by DA Happ
Evidence closed. 

Opportunity to present a closing argument by Atty. Henry. 
Closing arguments presented by DA Hall. 

Court presents basis for findings and orders including that the defense did not meet the required burden.  
The motion to withdraw plea is denied. 
The motion to modify the reporting requirement is denied. 

Procedural posture reviewed by the Court and Counsel. 
DA to submit a proposed order under the 5-day rule. 
Recess 4:05pm
IT IS ORDERED that the time for the circuit court to decide the postconviction motion is hereby extended to February 13, 2021.
Calendar call on January 8, 2021 at 08:15 am.

(SF) Case called at 10:37 am (All appearances are by Zoom)
Defendant James A. Carroll in court with Attorney Kathleen Green Henry. DA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court finds that the video is sight and sound sufficient.
Court reviews that todays hearing is set on Defendant's Motion to Withdraw his plea.

DA Hall advises that todays hearing should be on whether or not there should be a hearing on the Defendant's Motion.
DA Hall advises that if the court decides that there should be a hearing the State is prepared to go forward with the evidentiary hearing.

Attorney Henry presents arguement in favor of the Court holding the evidentiary hearing today.

recess: 10:45 am to allow Attorney Henry and Defendant to meet.
reconvene: 10:50 am
Appearances are the same.

Court and Counsel discuss the Court of Appeals deadline.
Court directs Attorney Henry to Motion for an Extension from the Court of Appeals.

Court reviews with parties that it will need to review the record, pleadings and transcripts of the file.
Attorney Henry advises that she will request an additional 60 day extension from the Court of Appeals.

Court and DA Hall discuss that the Court will make an interm decision between the December 15 court date and the January 29 hearing date as to the Court's determination if an Evidentiary Hearing should be granted based on the Court's review of the record, pleadings and transcripts of the file.

It is Ordered that the motion to extend time is construed as a petition for a writ of habeas corpus. This matter shall be docketed accordingly. The petitioner must pay the filing fee or establish that he is entitled to fee waiver within fourteen days of the date of this order.

It is further ordered that, upon this court's resolution of the fee issue, this matter shall be remanded to the circuit court for an evidentiary hearing. The circuit court shall enter findings of fact relevant to the petition and shall return those findings to this court within 60 days of the remand from this court. The court will then make the ultimate determination as to the merits of the petition.
It is Ordered that the State shall inform this court within 14 days of the date of this order whether it opposes the motion , and if so, on what grounds

[NL] Cases 15CF254 and 15CM108 called 4:05 p,m
Defendant James A. Carroll in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Defendant James A. Carroll in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed. 
Recess 4:12 pm (for Mr. Carroll to meet with Attorney De La Rosa)
Reconvene  4:18 pm
The elements are recited. Pleas of "No Contest" are entered in Case 15CF254 on Count #4 & Count #6 of the Amended information; factual basis stipulated with Attorney De La Rosa clarifying the stipulation as to facts; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Carroll guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1, #2, #3 and #5 of case 15CF254, and the entirety of case 15CM108.

On Count #4, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Carroll on Probation for 3 years.
On Count #6, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Carroll on Probation for 2 years, concurrent.
 
Conditions of Probation on both counts are:
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy, counseling, and follow through as may be required by the Agent
_No contact with SAW DOB 10/14/68
_No presence at or near the residence, school, or employment of SAW
_Sex Offender supervision per the Department of Corrections, including, among other conditions, no use of internet or like communications without Agent authorization. 
- No contact with any child. 
-No presence at any facility such as parks, playgrounds, carnivals, waterparks or similar facilities where children are known to gather
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge as calculated by the clerk.

The Court orders Sex Offender Registration for the length of the Probation term plus 15 years. 
The Court directs that Mr. Carroll is to meet with the Jefferson County Department of Corrections before he is taken to Dane County by authorities.

Days credit for time already served: 129 days
recess 4:44 pm
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on June 14 & 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] cases #15CF254, #15CM108 called at 10:48am. 
Defendant James A. Carroll in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that there has not been any resolution of the cases so trial is needed. 
Counsel agree that a two-day trial length should be set in the felony case, and that the misdemeanor case should track the felony case.
Attorney De La Rosa requests that trial be set in June or later because he is still awaiting the remainder of the discovery from [previous counsel] Attorney Gonzalez. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense will be filing a motion to modify bond. 
recess 10:54am. 

NEXT:  (1) Attorney De La Rosa will contact the JA to schedule/file the Motion to Modify Bond, (2) Scheduling Order is to be issued in Case #15CF254, (3) FSSC in Case #15CF254 and Status Conference in Case #15CM108--both on June 8th at 3:00pm,  (4) Two Day Jury Trial in Case #15CF254 on June 14th & 15th, 8:30am  (this is a #1 setting; the Wednesday start-date is agreed to by both parties)
Status conference on March 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.
De La Rosa

Witness Payment Voucher Report
Total Costs of Case
Amended Bond

[MK] case called at 9:10am. 
Defendant James A. Carroll in court, in custody, with Attorney Jason Gonzalez.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
[This case is scheduled for Jury Trial today; a Jury Panel has been assembled and is waiting outside of the courtroom.]
Attorney Gonzalez provides a summary of his meetings with Mr. Carroll that occurred over the weekend, and the subsequent action that Attorney Gonzalez was required to take under SCR 20.1(6b) in regard to Mr. Carroll voicing threats of violence and harm to himself and to other specified individuals.
Attorney Gonzalez Motions for Trial Adjournment.
ADA Hall indicates that she has discussed trial adjournment with the alleged victim.  It is understood that the Court is not able to proceed with the Jury Trial today. 
Attorney Gonzalez Motions to Withdraw as Counsel based on the unavoidable conflict he now has in the case.  Attorney Gonzalez has already been in communication with Attorney De La Rosa regarding the issue that has arisen, and Attorney Gonzalez will follow through with arranging for the appointment of successor Public Defender counsel. 
The Court grants the Motion to Withdraw-- Attorney Gonzalez would likely be a witness in relation to any potential new charges; that creates a conflict of interest that would not be waive-able.
The Court notes that this is the third scheduling of a jury trial in this case.  The Court emphasizes to Mr. Carroll that the Court will not allow Mr. Carroll to manipulate the system to avoid going to trial. 

ADA Hall orally Motions in Increase the Bond based on the new allegations being a violation of Bond. 
The Court raises the Bond amount to $5,000 Cash.
recess 9:25am.  

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Gonzalez is to file a written Motion/proposed Order to Withdraw,   (2) schedule a Status Hearing in approximately thirty days--to be held at the Waukesha County Courthouse; ADA Hall may appear by telephone for this hearing

State of Wisconsin vs. James Carroll, Jefferson County Case
2015CF254- Jury Status Hearing
2015CM108  Hearing

Thursday, January 26, 2017, 10:30 a.m.
Judge Michael J. Aprahamain
Court Reporter:  Rose Roderick
Clerk:  Hope Gronewold

ADA Monica Hall appeared in person.
Attorney Jason Gonzalez appeared by phone.
Defendant James Carroll appears in person.

The parties advise the Court they are ready to proceed to jury tria on 15CF254.  The trial will start at 8:15 a.m. on Monday, January 30, 2017 in Jefferson County, Branch 4 and is expected to last 2 days.  

Attorney Gonzalez requests the Court allow expert Dr. Richard Tovar to appear via telephone or video.  Attorney Hall does not object to Mr. Tovar to appear by video or phone but would prefer he appear by video.  Dr. Tovar would appear the 2nd day of trial on Tuesday, January 31, 2017.  Attorney Hall requests that Attorney Gonzalez provide Dr. Tovars opinion to her prior to the trial. The Court orders Attorney Gonzalez to provide in writing Dr. Tovars opinion by email to ADA Hall by 4:30 tomorrow, Friday, January 27, 2017.  

The Defendant enters a not guilty plea to all 6 counts of the 2nd amended information.  

The Court will address any motions in limine the morning of the trial.  Attorney Gonzalez does not plan to file a Miranda Goodchild motion.    The parties are to discuss the motions in limine prior to the jury trial and advise the Court what motions will be covered the morning of the trial.
Jury trial on January 30, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on January 26, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Scheduling order
Original Bond Document Received from JESO on 8/10/15

[MK] case called at 1:22pm. 
Defendant James A. Carroll appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Carroll verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
ADA Teuber requests that Preliminary Hearing be scheduled within the time limit. Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense does not take a position on this. 

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with S.A.W.
--no presence at the South Street Apartment complex in Johnson Creek
--no intimate physical contact with any females 
recess 1:32pm.
